title: Add post creation functionality to all sections

requirements.text: Update the HomePage component to display the CreatePostForm above the post feed, allowing authenticated users to create posts that appear in the general feed without specifying a section

quotes: You didn't add a way to post anything

acceptanceCriteria: CreatePostForm appears on HomePage above the post feed
Form is only visible to authenticated users
Posts created from HomePage appear in the general feed
Form follows the same styling and behavior as the section-specific CreatePostForm

requirements.text: Verify that the CreatePostForm component is properly integrated into the SectionPage component for Civil Debate, Aggressive Debate, Quotes & Poems, and Random Debates sections, ensuring authenticated users can create section-specific posts

quotes: You didn't add a way to post anything

acceptanceCriteria: CreatePostForm is visible on all four section pages (Civil Debate, Aggressive Debate, Quotes & Poems, Random Debates)
Form is only visible to authenticated users
Posts created from section pages are automatically tagged with the correct section type
Form submission successfully creates posts that appear in the section-specific feed

requirements.text: Add visual feedback and success messaging to the CreatePostForm component so users receive confirmation when their post is successfully created, including clearing the form fields and optionally scrolling to show the new post in the feed
acceptanceCriteria: Success toast notification appears when post is created successfully
Form fields clear after successful submission
User receives clear feedback if post creation fails
Optional: Page scrolls to show the newly created post in the feed

constraints: Do not modify backend/main.mo - post creation logic already exists
Do not modify the CreatePostForm component structure - it already exists and handles post creation
Maintain the current authentication flow using Internet Identity
Keep the section-specific post tagging mechanism that already exists
nonGoals: Changing the post data model or backend logic
Adding new post types beyond the existing four sections
